description.title: Every Datapoint a Person
description.subtitle: The Brooks / Diagram of a Slave Ship
description.description: Before there are data, there are people. People who offer up their lives as data — or whose lives become data without consent.

dubois.title: Between Data and Truth
dubois.subtitle: W. E. B. Du Bois's “Data Portraits”
dubois.description: How can data visualization bear witness to oppression? How can it hold space for what cannot be conveyed through data alone?

labor.title: The Process is the Product
labor.subtitle: The Making of Data by Design
labor.description: Any digital project is the work of many hands. How can this labor be visualized? What labor remains out of sight?

peabody.title: The Work of Knowledge
peabody.subtitle: Elizabeth Palmer Peabody's Chronological Grids
peabody.description: We have come to believe that data visualizations should be clear and efficient. Is there value in designs that make us pause and reflect?

playfair.title: What Visualization Reveals
playfair.subtitle: William Playfair's Time-Series Charts
playfair.description: Data visualization has never been neutral or objective. There is a meaning — and an argument — conveyed through each design.

shanawdithit.title: Narratives of Possession
shanawdithit.subtitle: Shanawdithit's Narrative Maps
shanawdithit.description: Maps can create nations and contest them. How have maps been used to document multiple pasts?
